content:
Fun one!

It would be great I think if both the standard routine test and validator both had a minute starting with 0.

Since no test right now checks that you are padding with 0 for the minutes. (meaning you can have 100% when testing in IDE but not in final validation.)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is a great CoC and can easily be solved in 5 minutes.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great challenge! I really enjoyed writing my own solution for it.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's an interesting, challenging puzzle that is not too hard for a Clash. Good one!

This is fabulous. I may have been on the edge of 15 minutes, but I actually learned something about math solving this.
1. I do have one big suggestion: it may seem obvious once you've read the whole thing, but you could save people some time by mentioning that it's a 24-hour clock, so there's no AM or PM to worry about.
2. A few small spelling and grammar things; they're not a big deal, but it would seem more professional:
"developed" (one P)
"the bad habit of snoozing them all"
"you will finally get up at 7:30 when they ring at the same time again" (no will)
Others might have a different opinion.
Well done!
Typo in the description. "when they all snooze together" should be "when they all ring together"

Fun clash.
A typo : "Standard rountine" -> "Standard routine'
Also validator "Standard rountine" has an incorrect "n" (6 instead of 7) leading to an incorrect answer if you take all 7 values into account
Nicely spotted, thank you. I corrected both the test and my python solution

Thank you for your very nice comment !
All corrections implemented, thank you for your precious help too.
